contentrichtext.text: {{Chinese-name|Xia}} {{Infobox Chinese-language singer and actor | name = Xia Gang | image = | pinyinchinesename = Xià Gāng | tradchinesename = 夏鋼 | simpchinesename = 夏钢 | birth_date = 1953 | birth_place = [[Beijing]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] | yearsactive = 1980s-present | occupation = [[Film director]] & [[Film producer|producer]] | parents = | goldenroosterawards = '''Best Director''':<br />1993 ''After Separation'' | awards = }} '''Xia Gang''' ({{zh|s=夏钢}}) (born 1953) is a [[Cinema of China|Chinese]] [[film director]]. A graduate of the 1982 class of the [[Beijing Film Academy]], Xia is a member of the so-called [[Cinema of China#The rise of the Fifth Generation, 1980s-1990s|Fifth Generation]], though unlike his classmates [[Tian Zhuangzhuang]] and [[Chen Kaige]], he did not gain prominence until relatively later, in the late 1980s.<ref name=Encyclopedia>Zhang, Yingjin & Xiao, Zhiwei (1998). "Xia Gang" in ''Encyclopedia of Chinese Film''. Taylor & Francis, p. 374. ISBN 0-415-15168-6.</ref> Like his contemporary [[Huang Jianxin]], Xia's works have focused on modern urban relationships and particularly [[marriage]] and love.<ref name=Encyclopedia/> His film ''[[Yesterday's Wine (film)|Yesterday's Wine]]'' (1995) is most indicative of his interest in modernity and relationships, as it details a young woman's maturation in a modern Chinese city. ==Selected
